scenario_text.value: I’m really glad you came back.
Sorry I worried you.

I didn’t want anybody to be sacrificed,
so I was honestly pretty upset...

I was in shock, so Aoi had to take over as
the group leader.
Aoi tried really hard, didn’t she?

I tried hard too, you know! It’s just that
Aoi tried harder.

Watching her was like a wake-up call. She was
a leader, through and through.

Thanks to her taking over, I was free to help
the professor investigate the inner shrine.

Ah, with adequate attention to safety, of
course.

I was just about to head back to the
investigation, actually.
(Shuuji looks like a new man, somehow.)

(I wonder if he secretly resents Aoi for
taking over the leadership role?)

(Wait, but then what was that about
investigating the inner shrine? I’m curious.)
(What should I say to him?)
You look refreshed.
You have no regrets?
What about the shrine?
You look refreshed.

You look really refreshed, Shuuji. Like you
have more room to breathe.

Really? Well, I definitely feel calmer than
I used to.

I was spinning my wheels so much up to now...
I should do the best I can, in my own way.
You have no regrets?

Don’t you have any regrets about Aoi taking
over as leader?

Ahaha! Well, I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t
frustrated about it.

Still, there’s a right man—or woman—for the
job. I want to help everyone my own way.
What about the shrine?

You said you were investigating the inner
shrine. Did you discover anything?

Oh right, about that... I learned a lot while
investigating with the professor.

We’re actually going to meet later to go over
the details and...
Ah! Not later, now, actually!

Sorry Takuma, I’ll tell you more later! It’s
time to join the professor’s investigation!

Oh, sorry to hold you up. Good luck out
there!

I have to work even harder...
That way, all of us can go home next time!

(Doesn’t look like I have to worry about
Shuuji anymore...)

Next time we’ll all go back together. I’ll
make sure it happens!
